fields.description:
Description from here: https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-97348

I'm using the getProjectRoleActors soap service in a "trusted application links" situation.

Normally in the trusted apps situation you can pass null as the token into all service calls. However, when passing null into getProjectRoleActors() I get the error message "Error getting project role actors The user does not have the JIRA Administrator permission, or is not running Enterprise and does not have the Project admin permission."

If I pass anything other than null as the token into getProjectRoleActors() then the service call correctly succeeds in my trusted apps use case.
fields.summary: getProjectRoleActors requires non-null token for TrustedApps, unlike the rest of the API.

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26368].
  {panel}

Hello,

it would be great, if there was a possibility to send an email-notification to *certain comments*.
I want to choose, which comments should be sent to the users specified in the notification scheme, not every comment or change on the ticket should cause an email.
In my imagination, there is a button on the right side of each comment, which is used for sending out an email to a specified recipient.

Is there already a feature like this?
fields.summary: Mail only certain comments

fields.description:
To reproduce:
# choose a set of issues for bulk operations which contains some closed issues
# choose all of them and select 'Transition' bulk operation
# choose close as the transition and confirm field updates (any choice is OK)
# on the confirmation screen you will notice that the number of selected issues displayed in left-hand navigation menu has decreased - the already closed issues have been automatically deselected
# now use the navigation menu to come back to step 2 ('Choose Operation') - the number of issues will remain decreased

Expected:
After coming back to Choose Operation (basically reverting all the steps regarding transition operation) I expect the number of selected issues to be restored to my original selection on first screen
fields.summary: Bulk operations - Issue selections for particular operation are retained after coming back to 'Choose operation' screen

fields.description:
Select issues for bulk operations, some of which you don't have permissions to edit. On the 'Choose Operation' step you should see form as on screenshot (with 'N/A' for Bulk Edit cause you don't have permissions). Trying to click on the Bulk Edit option causes Javascript errors in all browsers.

IE8 shows a browser popup with the error information, for other browsers check the console.
fields.summary: Javascript error when choosing bulk edit operation with no permission to edit all issues

fields.description:
Go to bulk edit and select issues from different projects and of different types. Select 'Move' as Operation. On step 3, Operation Details, click next on first screen and you should see a bunch of sub-steps under step 3 (for each Project/Issue Type combination). Now use the side menu to navigate back to Step 2, and choose any other operation. On Step 3 you will still see all the sub-steps in the navigation menu, even though they don't apply to any other operation than Move. 

See screenshot.
fields.summary: Bulk edit/move - operation details for Move operation are displayed for other operations

fields.description:
When JIRA returns a 401/403/404/etc response, the response is always in HTML, no matter what the client {{Accept}} header is.

We should take into account the {{Accept}} header and support at least JSON and XML, in addition to HTML.
fields.summary: Error responses are always in HTML, regardless of Accept: header

fields.description:
In JIRA 5.0rc1 (what JAC is currently running on), the text indicating that a comment has viewing restrictions has been changed back to black. It used to be a dark red colour, which made it very easy to skim a page and look for the comments that have restrictions. Now that this is gone, it's much much more difficult. I'd like to see the red return (or at least a different colour that is immediately visible from the rest of the page).

!https://img.skitch.com/20111123-8qphf9fidknx4985ndp1q4a7tf.jpg!
fields.summary: Comment security level text is black, not red, in JIRA 5.0rc1, makes it much harder to scan the page for restricted comments

fields.description:
In my findings (https://developer.atlassian.com/display/JIRADEV/JIRA+Plugin+Lifecycle), the LifecycleAware onStart method seems to be called *after* {{PluginEnabledEvent}} occurs when starting up JIRA, but well *before* {{PluginModuleEnabledEvent}} when installing/enabling a plugin.

This lack of consistency in timing makes it difficult for plugin developers to write useful code for the LifecycleAware onStart method.
fields.summary: LifecycleAware onStart timing for plugin components is not consistent across different scenarios

fields.description:
I'm a Firefox fan but several of our developers and most of the management are using Microsoft's Internet Explorer 9.   There are several cases where the pulldown menues are not working:

1/ On the IssueNavigator page, the 'Views' or 'Tools' pulldown menu do not work.
http://jira:8080/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=assignee+%3D+currentUser%28%29+AND+resolution+%3D+unresolved+ORDER+BY+priority+DESC%2C+created+ASC

2/ As well, on the IssueNavigator page, the individual 'Actions' pulldown menues do not work

3/ Under the top level 'Edit' menu. i.e.
http://jira:8080/secure/EditIssue!default.jspa?id=15479
   None of the pulldown menus for Component/s, Affects Version/s, Fix Version/ but the pulldown menu for Assignees work.

In summary, IE9 is a support platform in Jira 4.4.3 but it definitely does not work on Windows 7.  It does work on latest Firefox, Safari, Chrome and IE8(on Windows 7 or XP)

I don't want to be telling my management team to use another browser especially when IE9 is suppose to be a supported browser.
fields.summary: IE 9 pulldown menus not working in latest 4.4.3 Jira

Upon performing a search via Issue Navigator, it is not possible to sort the results by select list custom field column if we configured the field search template to None. Upon sorting the search results, JIRA will crash with the following error is produced:

	at javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet.service(HttpServlet.java:717)
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServletWrapper.service(JspServletWrapper.java:386)
	at org.apache.jasper.servlet.JspServlet.serviceJspFile(JspServlet.java:313)
.....
Caused by: java.lang.ClassCastException: com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.option.LazyLoadedOption cannot be cast to java.lang.String
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.customfields.impl.SelectCFType.compare(SelectCFType.java:40)
	at com.atlassian.jira.issue.fields.CustomFieldImpl.compare(CustomFieldImpl.java:1740)

- Perform searches in the Issue Navigator, and add the custom field as a navigator column
- Try to sort the results.

fields.description:
Dear,

We did an export-import of Jira data from version 3.13 to Version 4.3. 
Everything works fine exeptionally when we click on 'Work log' of an issue to see the history of the entered worked hours, we receive the error message "An unknown error occurred - actions == null. Please see logs for more details." 
This only appears when there are hours nog logged by the current user. fe. User x logged hours on Issue 1 in Jira 3.13, when user x clicks on Work log, he can see the history, when user y clicks on worklog of Issue1, he receives the error message.

The same message appears when we click on 'All' but not on the other tabs like comments or Change History.

This is an importand issue for us because we planned the upgrade next saterday the 26th of November.

Regards,
Evelyne
fields.summary: work log error - "An unknown error occurred - actions == null. Please see logs for more details."

Hello,

I would like to request a stalker bar. The blue bar in JIRA containing "Dashboard, Projects, issues, agile, create issue and search field" is not visible if there are to much comments on a page and the user scrolls down the page.

A stalker bar will remain visible where ever the user is on a page and therefore it's access ability is better.

I hope you can use this request.

Kind regards,

Xander

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Create a trusted applink between JIRA_A and JIRA_B.
# Create a remote link between issue_X on JIRA_A and issue_Y on JIRA_B.
# Move issue_Y (remote issue) to a different project.
# Refresh the view issue_X page and verify that the issue key and URL are the new values (after async loading)
# Remove trusted apps and configure applinks to use OAuth instead (without approving access yet)
# Go to the view issue_X page.

*Expected*
Issue key and URL is updated after the first async load of the issue link reveals that the issue key and URL has changed.

*Actual*
Issue key and URL are the old values.
fields.summary: Remote JIRA Issue Link should update the issue key and URL when remote JIRA issue is moved

Pre-requisite: Use JIRA5.0_QAData.zip
1. Log in as a JIRA User.
2. Launch Quick Edit/Create in All mode.
3. Tabs wrap down to two rows on the dialog.

fields.description:
On FF8

1. Add any gadget, which shows list of issues and gives a Cog icon to perform different actions.
2. Click on the COG against an issue once.
3. Click the COG against the same issue again, nothing happens.
Same behaviour persists on JIRA v4.4.4-SNAPSHOT#664-r166734

This behaviour does not exist in 5.0 Beta3 ( http://qa-eacj.atlassian.com )

On Chrome and IE9

1. When COG is clicked, the menu is opened, open any action in new TAB.
   Menu remains Stay Put. 
I have to click else where on the screen to get rid of that menu.

This behaviour is present on 5.0 Beta 3 too.
fields.summary: COG Behaviour is not consistent in Gadgets.

fields.description:
I was testing the "Contact Administrators" form, and noticed that the emails coming back looked a little strange. Here's what I found in the message source: {noformat}

Sorry, please ignore this.
This message is automatically generated by JIRA.
If you think it was sent incorrectly, please contact your JIRA administrators.
For more information on JIRA, see: http://www.atlassian.com/software/jira
{noformat} There are a few issues I found: # configurable CSS colors are not being substituted in correctly # {{$textutils.htmlEncode($jiraLogoUrl)}} --- broken logo image (this instance uses a custom logo) # Relative "JIRA administrators" URL --- {{/secure/ContactAdministrators!default.jspa}} I was unable to determine whether this is an OnDemand-specific issue or a general JIRA problem.
fields.summary: "Contact Administrators" email contains un-interpolated variables

log4j can filter the stack trace output and JIRA should put some smarts into this.
fields.summary: JIRA should cut down the size of the stack traces it generates.
Restructure Add User Dirctory page so Advanced Connection Test has to be performed
Add a "re-index needed" flag, that plugins can set when installed/upgraded/configured

fields.description:
Steps needed to reproduce the behaviour:
# Setup JIRA with default language e.g. English.
# As an anonymous user navigate to Dashboard where Login gadget should be displayed.
!login_en.png!
# From General Configuration change 'Default language' to another language eg Spanish.
# Repeat step Step 2.
!login_es.png!
Internal part of the gadget is still presented in English.
# Clear the browser's cache and repeat Step 2.
!login_es_ok.png!
This time the gadget correctly displays its content in Spanish.

HAR export for the Dashboard requests attached in _login.har_
fields.summary: Caching Login Gadget causes translation issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26304].
  {panel}

Adding 'anyone' to jira-system-administrators privileges breaks admin panel.

So, aside from the obviously bad nature of adding the anyone group to this permission, it tends to leave things in a broken state afterwards. The Admin panel does not render anything and there are stack traces in the logs like this:

{noformat}
Nov 11, 2011 4:05:07 PM org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationDispatcher
invoke
SEVERE: Servlet.service() for servlet jsp threw exception
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: entityNameToMatch argument cannot be
null
at org.apache.commons.lang.Validate.notNull(Validate.java:192)
at
com.atlassian.crowd.search.query.membership.MembershipQuery.<init>(MembershipQuery.java:26)
at
com.atlassian.crowd.search.query.membership.UserMembersOfGroupQuery.<init>(UserMembersOfGroupQuery.java:11)
at
com.atlassian.crowd.search.builder.QueryBuilder.createMembershipQuery(QueryBuilder.java:179)
at
com.atlassian.crowd.search.builder.QueryBuilder$PartialMembershipQueryWithNameToMatch.returningAtMost(QueryBuilder.java:287)
at
com.atlassian.jira.user.util.UserUtilImpl.getGroupMembers(UserUtilImpl.java:1197)
...
{noformat}

What's curious about this, is I can't replicate it on a clean install, but the problem has occurred to a number of customers - they did appear to be using apache or other proxies to clean up the URL in each case.

We've got a number of tickets about warning people when adding the anyone group here - I wonder if there's possibly now enough reason to prevent people from adding the anyone group to jira-system-admins at all? Is there even a use case for that permission?

h3. Workaround

Please refer to our [Error Creating New Ticket or Accessing Administration Section After JIRA Upgrade|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRAKB/Error+Creating+New+Ticket+or+Accessing+Administration+Section+After+JIRA+Upgrade] KB article for further information on how to fix this.

h3. Suggested Fix

Add an upgrade task to check for this, and if it exists remove those 'Anyone' permissions provided it does not restrict access to log into the instance.

h3. Notes

It is also possible this error may occur when performing an in-place upgrade from 3.3.1 to 4.4.5. This is not the recommended method, please use the XML method as per [Upgrading JIRA 3.x Data to JIRA 6.x|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Upgrading+JIRA+3.x+Data+to+JIRA+6.x].

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26298].
  {panel}

*Steps to reproduce*
# Configure two JIRA application to use the same connector port at {{server.xml}}
# Startup the first JIRA
# Use the upgrade tool (atlassian-jira-4.4-x32.bin) to upgrade the second JIRA
{quote}
Your existing JIRA installation is about to be upgraded! Do you want to proceed?
Yes [y, Enter], No [n]

Your instance of JIRA is currently being upgraded.
Checking if JIRA has been shutdown...
JIRA failed to shutdown. Please kill the process manually before proceeding.
Continue [c, Enter], Exit [e]
{quote}

It seems that the upgrade tool use the port number in {{server.xml}} to detect whether the application is running.
However, the message of the failure is not clear if the port is used by other application.

Should have a warning message asking if there is any application using the same port.
fields.summary: A better warning message if the upgrade tool fail because of the port used by other application

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26297].
  {panel}

Please polish the content I am providing below and include it in JIRA 4.4.4 release notes (or perhaps rather summarise it with a sentence or two and link to a separate page with more details).

As described in JRA-26239, we decided to break backward compatibility in JIRA 4.4.4 release with respect to a piece of the API related to mail handling (which, as far as we know, is not used often).

h2. Incompatibilities

JIRA 4.4.4 includes a dependency on {{atlassian-mail}} version {{1.25}} which is not 100% backward compatible with {{atlassian-mail 1.24}} included in previous releases of JIRA.

JRIA 4.4.4 also ships with {{javamail 1.4.4}}, which we cannot guarantee is 100% compatible with {{javamail 1.4.1}} (shipped with previous releases of JIRA).

Hence, there are two significant points to note as a result of these changes:
* The {{com.atlassian.mail.server.MailServer.getSession()}} method returns objects of the {{javax.mail.Session}} class rather than {{alt.javax.mail.Session}}
* The classes from {{mockobjects-j1.3-j2ee1.3.jar}} are no longer exported (i.e. made available) to Atlassian version 2 plugins. This {{jar}} is no longer distributed with JIRA.

h2. Potential Impact and Solution

* We believe that very few (if any) 3rd party plugins will be affected by the two changes mentioned above and that such plugins will be broken as a result of these changes.
\\
** If your plugin uses the {{com.atlassian.mail.server.MailServer.getSession()}} method, doing either of the following should be sufficient to get it working with JIRA 4.4.4:
*** Recompile your plugin against 4.4.4
*** Use a higher level class like {{MailQueueItem}}.
\\ \\
** If your plugin depends on {{mockobjects-j1.3-j2ee1.3.jar}} (which is highly unlikely and could be considered questionable), we encourage you to either:
*** Remove this dependency or
*** If it is not possible to remove this dependency, bundle this {{jar}} with the plugin.

According to the changelog for {{javamail}} (http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javaee/changes-220864.txt), we believe that these changes should not negatively impact current plugins. On the contrary, many bug fixes and compatibility improvements in this new version of {{javamail}} should make existing JIRA mail handlers more robust.

h2. Rationale

JIRA 4.4.4 comes with substantial mail logging improvements and capabilities, which should be valuable to customers and support personnel troubleshooting problems related to incoming and outgoing mail.

Part of this feature work required the need to upgrade both the {{atlassian-mail}} and {{javamail}} libraries to the versions mentioned above. The anticipated small negative impact resulting from these upgraded libraries led us to believe that there was little or no business justification for supporting their older versions.
fields.summary: Document mail-related API incompatibilities in incoming JIRA 4.4.4

fields.description:
Customer can't select text (for copy-paste) in JIRA tickets in Chrome, Safari, Firefox browsers. However, we can select text in Opera and IE 8 & IE 9.

The behaviors for each browser are:

* On Chrome, the entire page is grabbed as if clicking and dragging an image, and JIRA attempts to attach this "image" to the ticket
* On Safari, like Chrome, the entire page is grabbed as if clicking and dragging an image, but JIRA does not try to attach this to the ticket
* On Firefox, unlike Chrome and Safari, the cursor changes to an I-beam cursor, but clicking and dragging over text does not highlight the text
* On Opera, IE 8, and IE 9, the text is selected as expected

[Here|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-95239] goes ticket of customer if you need any further information.
fields.summary: Can't select attachment file names (for copy-paste) in JIRA issues in Chrome, Safari, Firefox browsers

fields.description:
h4. *+Steps to reproduce+*
# download and extract JIRA Zip Archive (not the latest version)
# edit *JIRA_Install/bin/setenv.bat* and add this parameter to specify JIRA_Home (Windows environment):
#* {{set JIRA_HOME=path/to/jira/home}}
# start JIRA and set it up, then shut it down
# download JIRA Installer of the latest version and run it to upgrade JIRA

h4. *+Expected behavior+*
The installer recognizes JIRA_Home set in *setenv.bat*

h4. *+Actual behavior+*
The following error is thrown:
!jira_home.png|thumbnail!

h4. *+Workaround+*
* quit the Installer
* [set jira.home from jira-application.properties|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+from+an+Archive+File+on+Windows%2C+Linux+or+Solaris#InstallingJIRAfromanArchiveFileonWindows,LinuxorSolaris-2.SettheJIRAHomeDirectoryinJIRA] or use [JIRA Configuration Tool|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Using+the+JIRA+Configuration+Tool]
* run the Installer to upgrade JIRA again

h4. *+Original Description+*
{quote}
Check following transcript - doing a ./atlassian-jira-4.4.3-x32.bin

{noformat}
Create a new JIRA installation. [1, Enter], Upgrade an existing JIRA installation. [2]
2
Existing JIRA installation directory:
[/opt/JIRA]
/opt/atlassian/jira/install
Unable to determine location of the home directory. 'jira.home' was not found inside jira-application.properties.
Finishing installation ...

[root@testjira download]# grep jira.home /opt/atlassian/jira/install/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/jira-application.properties 
# The jira.home property must be set before you start JIRA. It specifies the directory in which JIRA will store its data files.
# NOTE: If you are using Windows, you will need to use double \ characters, for example c:\jira\home should be written
# You can also use Unix-like paths which Java/JIRA can handle, eg c:/jira/home
jira.home = 

[root@testjira download]# grep -i jira.home /opt/atlassian/jira/install/bin/setenv.sh 
# One way to set the JIRA HOME path is here via this variable.  Simply uncomment it and set a valid path like /jira/home.  You can of course set it outside in the command terminal.  That will also work.
JIRA_HOME="/opt/atlassian/jira/data"
{noformat}

Workaround - set the jira.home in jira-application.properties, don't use the one in setenv.sh ...
{quote}
fields.summary: Jira install procedure doesn't take into account JIRA_HOME set in setenv.sh when doing an upgrade

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26276].
  {panel}

As discussed in [JSP-95513|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-95513] it is currently not possible to set the property option {{ops.bar.group.size.opsbar-transitions}} to 0

I expected the following behavior:
* (-) set value to 0: Only the "Workflow" Dropdown is visible, all Transitions are included there
* (/) set a value x betweed 1 and n-1 (where n is the number of maximum transitions available atm): get x Buttons plus the workflow dropdown with additional transitions (works as expected)
* (!) set a value x that is higher than the maximum of transitions available: get all transtitions as buttons (nevertheless it is good to the users UI) but hide the Workflow Dropdown (currently only the workflow field is disabled but not hidden)

fields.description:
When a plugin developer creates a webwork action with the same name as a JIRA webwork the autowiring fails.

Here is a "DeleteWorklog" webwork that we have defined in our plugin:

{code}
    <webwork1 key="DeleteWorklogWebWork" name="Tempo Delete Worklog Action">
        <actions>
            <action name="com.tempoplugin.worklog.action.DeleteWorklog" alias="TempoDeleteWorklog">
               ...
            </action>
        </actions>
    </webwork1>
{code}

This works fine in our plugin and our alias works fine but when the user tries to use the standard "DeleteWorklog" action on the "Work Log" tab she gets this error: 

{code}
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 2011-11-16 10:20:12,003 http-2990-13 ERROR bjarnit 620x2957x1 blsvr7 10.41.105.159 /secure/DeleteWorklog!default.jspa [jira.config.webwork.JiraActionFactory] Error autowiring Action 'com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.DeleteWorklog'.
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] org.springframework.beans.factory.UnsatisfiedDependencyException: 
Error creating bean with name 'com.atlassian.jira.web.action.issue.DeleteWorklog': 
Unsatisfied dependency expressed through constructor argument with index 1 of type [com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.comment.CommentService]: : 
No unique bean of type [com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.comment.CommentService] is defined: 
Unsatisfied dependency of type [interface com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.comment.CommentService]: expected at least 1 matching bean; 
nested exception is org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException: 
No unique bean of type [com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.comment.CommentService] is defined: 
Unsatisfied dependency of type [interface com.atlassian.jira.bc.issue.comment.CommentService]: expected at least 1 matching bean
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.ConstructorResolver.createArgumentArray(ConstructorResolver.java:591)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.ConstructorResolver.autowireConstructor(ConstructorResolver.java:193)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.autowireConstructor(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:925)
[INFO] [talledLocalContainer] 	at org.springframework.beans.factory.support.AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.createBeanInstance(AbstractAutowireCapableBeanFactory.java:835)
{code}

Also note that we have seen similar behavior with resources. When two plugins installed at the same instance both define *i18n.properties* as the resource one resource seems to be overwritten by the other meaning that one plugin is not localized!

The workaround that we are practicing is to simply prefix all webworks classes (like "TempoDeleteWorklog.java") but you can't expect every plugin vendor to do that!

Best regards,

-Bjarni, Tempo team
fields.summary: Autowire error when a plugin webwork action class has same name as JIRA webwork action class

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-26272].
  {panel}

As documented in https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JSP-96310 it's not possible anymore to easily modify the default filters shown
on the profile page. As a result, if a company want the users to quickly show issues in a custom status, there's no way to reach that.
See screenshot.

For example, the "Assigned & In Progress" filter is hard-coded to jira-url/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?reset=true&jqlQuery=status+%3D+%223%22+AND+assignee+%3D+currentUser%28%29
which translates to this jql: status = "3" AND assignee = currentUser()  

If the open status is not 3, or if we have different stati that represent "Open", we cannot change that.

It would be nice to be able to customize those queries, either by editing the jsp or having a property for each

Thanks
Olivier
fields.summary: Provide a way to customize the default filters shown on the profile page

fields.description:
1 - Set up an issue security scheme with the following security level:

* Reporter
* Assignee
* User Custom Field Value and choose the custom field you created for the JIRA Watcher Plugin
(this is the default security level)

2 - Create an issue and add a user as the CC of the issue. 
3 - Add a comment to the issue, visible to anyone. (Comment is the word "OK" for example)
4 - Log in JIRA as the user that is the CC of the issue.
5 - Access the issue, you will be able to browse it.
6 - Perform the following search in your Issue Navigator:

{noformat}
project = Test and status = Open
{noformat}

The issue will appear on your Issue Navigator.

7 - Then perform the following search:

{noformat}
project = Test and status = Open and comment ~ OK
{noformat}

The issue is no longer retrieved in the Issue Navigator.

If the Issue Security is removed from the issue, the search:

{noformat}
project = Test and status = Open and comment ~ OK
{noformat}

Returns the issue.
fields.summary: Security Scheme with JIRA Watcher Field Plugin doesn't work properly
